content: Some third quarter highlights include; revenue increased 8% sequentially to a company record 184 million adjusted EBITDA improved by 13% sequentially, adjusted EBITDA margins were 34%, up 140 basis points versus the second quarter. Rental revenues were 27 million for the quarter up 14% versus the second quarter, driving a 450 basis point increase in gross margins resulting from lower depreciation expense as a percentage of revenue. SG&A was flat at 8.7% of revenue during the period, the third quarter included nearly $1 million of professional and legal expenses related to the evaluation of growth opportunities. Third quarter adjusted EBITDA was approximately $63 million, up 13% from 56 million during the second quarter. During the third quarter, we paid a quarterly dividend of $0.11 per share resulting in a cash outflow of approximately $8.5 million, including related distributions to members. Your line is now open. Your line is now open. Your line is now open. It seems to be kind of happening in more aggressive numbers over the last quarter, can you just kind of refresh us on how you're thinking about what's out there on the M&A landscape and at what point would you just say, we got over $4 in cash, no debt we're going to accelerate capital returns. Your line is now open.
